text: hi this is Seema and I am back with
another lesson on idioms related to your
favorite thing in the world
money well all of us want a lot of money
don't you well we will now learn some
idioms and some common phrases in
relation to it the first one is easy
money easy money refers to nothing but
money earned easily or money earned
without putting a lot of effort into it
so for example you know when some
college students you know when they're
studying they kind of take really easy
jobs to support them with their their
expenses eating out and things like that
so they're really doing something which
is very easy to earn from and therefore
something that does not require a lot of
hard work put into it and therefore they
are supposed to be earning easy money on
the other hand you have a phrase like
give somebody a run for their money
now what does that mean it means
competing efficiently so for example a
company like Samsung which has launched
the new Samsung deal it is given it is
giving companies like Apple and Sony a
run for their money because their
smartphones have kind of you know
increased in its sale like you know like
nothing ever seen before and therefore
companies like Apple and Sony which have
ruled the market as far as smartphones
are concerned are really getting a run
for their money because now Samsung is
kind of you know technologically
advanced enough to have more products
and kind of bite into their market share
so when companies or individuals compete
in a particular field that expression of
giving somebody a run for their money
becomes very important
moving on to go broke broke well the
very word suggests that a person has
lost all his money so I know this person
you know who had a lot of shares he
invested a lot and when the recent
recession in the year 2008 kind of came
about he lost practically everything so
the expression a person goes broke means
he loses all his money he loses
everything that he's ever had that's
going broke
moving on to make ends meet making ends
meet is nothing but having just
sufficient money to survive so you have
only the money that is needed to survive
you cannot you know buy new clothes you
cannot go to fancy restaurants you can
only pay your rent maybe your
electricity bills you can put a little
food on the table but you can't do you
know the extra things like going out
watching movies you can't do that
because you are now making ends meet
this normally happens during times of a
recession you know financial trouble
really moving on to not made of money
this is a very common expression used to
say used by people when they want to say
that I do not have enough money I have
less money so a lot of you know wives
they kind of pestered their husbands for
shopping they want to go out shopping
and their husbands go like I'm not made
of money you know stop bugging me
okay well not made of money really means
having insufficient money so you don't
want to trouble somebody who is not made
of money he's not going to help you
laughing all the way to the bank what
does this expression mean it basically
means earning a lot of money because or
due to someone else's stupidity well you
know for example you you know you
invested in a business which someone
else could not quite run because he did
not have the kind of knowledge to run it
now you have taken hold of that business
you have put in your efforts and you
have made it grow to an extent that it
is really earning you a lot of profits
so you take all those profits and you're
making a lot of money now so you are
literally laughing all the way to the
bank so you are going running to the
bank and putting in the money in there
every day and you are laughing which
means you're actually laughing at this
person's stupidity because you know that
he could have earned as much as you are
doing right now so that is what laughing
all the way to the bank means when you
are earning because somebody else
couldn't and you are moving on to
strapped for cash strapped for cash is
nothing but being short of money being
short of cash so if I say that please
lend me five pounds I am strapped for
cash I'm talking about being almost out
of money or having very little money for
that matter
moving on to Blood Money okay Blood
Money as the name suggests me it could
mean exploiting someone for money for
making money or earning money at the
expense of somebody's death so blood
money is money that has been earned by
not very good means so an assassin could
earn blood money by killing someone
that's blood money a lot of people you
know they kind of exploit children and
you know they make diamonds of because
diamonds are you know found in diamond
mines and you have a little children
working in diamond mines
so that's blood money actually moving on
to money talks
money talks is influencing with your
power your money or your you know you
know the wealth that you have with you
so money talks is an expression saying
that you know people with money they are
the ones who control the situation so a
very rich person could you know could
kind of come into the room and get a
reserved table for him because money
talks
meaning that he has influence over a
particular play
because of his money moving on to put
your money where your mouth is well this
means nothing but to act on your words
well a lot of people you know they they
promise to do things they have good
intentions to do things but they're not
able to follow up on their words so a
lot of people look at homeless children
and want to do everything for them but
they don't so in such cases are an
expression like people who want to help
homeless children should really put
their money where their mouth is in
other words they should act on their
words they should follow up on their
words by acting on it all right well
